definitions.definition: The act of abolishing ; an annulling ; abrogation .
examples: the abolition of debts; the abolition of laws; the abolition of slavery; the abolition of police; the abolition of taxes
definitions.dating_raw: First attested around the early 16 century.

definitions.definition: The ending of the slave trade or of slavery .
definitions.dating_raw: First attested around the early 18 century.
First attested around the late 18 century.

definitions.definition: An amnesty ; a putting out of memory.
definitions.dating_raw: Attested from the early 17 century to the early 19 century.

main_definition: The act of abolishing ; an annulling ; abrogation . [First attested around the early 16 century.]
secondary_definitions: ( historical , often capitalised , UK , US ) The ending of the slave trade or of slavery . [First attested around the early 18 century.]
( historical , often capitalised , Australia ) The ending of convict transportation. [First attested around the late 18 century.]
( obsolete ) An amnesty ; a putting out of memory. [Attested from the early 17 century to the early 19 century.]
